title: Rate of change - at a point with concavity

content.question:
​

The x axis ranges from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 2 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (negative 3.5 comma negative 2.5).

The curve increases to cross the x axis at (negative 3.2 comma 0).

The curve continues to increase, gradually leveling off to a high point at (negative 2.3 comma 1.8).

The curve gradually decreases to its steepest point at about (negative 1.2 comma 1) then levels off at the origin, where it attains a low point.

The curve gradually increases to its steepest point at about (1.2 comma 1), then passes through the point (1.8 comma 1.6), labeled A, gradually leveling off at a high point at (2.3 comma 1.8).

The curve gradually decreases to cross the x axis at (3.2 comma 0).

The curve continues to decrease and exit the window at (3.5 comma negative 2.5).

The curve appears to be symmetric about the y axis.

​The graph of the function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and a point labeled <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> on the graph are shown. Which of the following statements about the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> at point <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> is true?

choices.label: ​At point <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math>, the rate of change of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is negative, and the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is concave down.
​​At point <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math>, the rate of change of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is negative, and the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is concave up.
​At point <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math>, the rate of change of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is positive, and the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is concave down.
​At point <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math>, the rate of change of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is positive, and the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is concave up.

content.answer: ​At point <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math>, the rate of change of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is positive, and the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is concave down.
